landing.title: NH48 API: Open data for New Hampshire’s 4,000-foot peaks and long trails

metaDescription.content: NH48 API provides open, structured data and photos for New Hampshire’s 48 four-thousand-foot peaks. Explore the catalog, routes, and White Mountain trails.

ogTitle.content: NH48 API – Open Trails and Peaks Data

ogDescription.content: Browse the peak catalog, explore White Mountain trails, and access long-distance route data for New Hampshire’s mountains.

landing.heroBody: Open data, routes, and photo metadata for New Hampshire’s 48 four-thousand-foot peaks. Browse the catalog, explore White Mountain trails, and build on top of the dataset.

notes.versioned: Versioned releases with changelog and citation-ready metadata.
notes.methodology: Provenance + collection methodology noted for peaks, routes, and trail segments.
notes.validation: Validation checks for elevation ranges, mileage, and geometry consistency.
notes.reproducible: Reproducible pipelines backed by source scripts and QA artifacts.

landing.author: Author: Nathan Sobol

nav.tagline: Open data & structured metadata for New Hampshire’s 4,000-foot peaks.

catalog.title: NH48 Peak Catalog
catalog.intro: Explore all forty-eight of New Hampshire’s 4,000-footers in one interactive catalog. Click any peak to view detailed summit info, routes, difficulty, and photos w/ creator metadata.

trailType.out_back_common_or_long_traverse: Out & back - common or long traverse
trailType.out_back_common_or_loop_with_connector_t: Out & back - common or loop with connector trails
trailType.out_back_common_or_small_loop_including_: Out & back - common or small loop including Mt Webster
trailType.out_back_or_loop_with_tom_and_willey: Out & back or loop - with Tom and Willey
trailType.out_back_or_loop_combining_trails: Out & back or loop combining trails

meta.descriptionTemplate: {name} – {elevation} ft high, {prominence} ft prominence, in the {range}. Routes, difficulty, and photos for this 4,000-footer.

trails.title: White Mountains Trails Map & List
trails.subtitle: Interactive WMNF trail map with GPX-backed route details.
trails.intro: Use this as a quick trail finder and completion tracker for the White Mountain National Forest. Open datasets and telemetry for New Hampshire’s 4,000-foot mountains.

details.title: Trail details
details.empty: Select a trail to view distance, elevation, and OpenStreetMap details.

list.noMatches: No trails found. Try a different search.

about.title: About this list
about.body: NH Tracing, Redlining, and White Mountain Trails all refer to the same collection of trails described in the guidebook. No matter which name you use, you’re working towards the same goal of experiencing these paths.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.body: This site is not intended for planning or navigation. Trail data may contain minor errors or inaccuracies, and this collection is not the official list (though it includes most of the known trails). Please refer to official sources and use good judgement in the backcountry.

howto.title: How to use
howto.body: Use the green circles to mark a trail as completed. After marking a trail, tap the calendar icon to add a date of completion — the date will replace the icon once selected and can be edited by tapping again. Your progress is stored locally in your browser. You can export or import your progress using the buttons below.

info.noProperties: No additional trail properties available yet. Properties will be populated from OpenStreetMap data.
info.loadingProperties: Loading additional trail properties from OpenStreetMap...
info.sourceNote: Information sourced from OpenStreetMap where available.

trails.confirmClear: Are you sure you want to clear all progress?
trails.alertLoadFail: Unable to load trail data. Please ensure you have internet connectivity and try refreshing the page.

map.attribution: Map data: © OpenStreetMap contributors, SRTM | Map style: © OpenTopoMap (CC-BY-SA)
